meaning_options.text: Complaining about bad weather.
Regretting something that cannot be changed.
Crying over something important that is lost.
Blaming others for one's own mistakes.

usage_options.text: He is crying over spilled milk because he cannot find his favorite socks.
After losing the championship game, the team was just crying over spilled milk.
When she spilled her coffee, she was literally crying over spilled milk.
He often cries over spilled milk, even when things go slightly wrong in his plans.

meaning_options.text: To literally bite a bullet.
To accept something difficult or unpleasant.
To bite into something very hard.
To start a difficult task with great energy.

usage_options.text: Knowing the potential backlash, he bit the bullet and told the truth.
When it's time to clean up after dinner, he always bites the bullet.
She bit the bullet at the dentist's office during her procedure.
He will have to bite the bullet and invest more to see results.

meaning_options.text: To shatter frozen water.
To initiate a conversation in a social setting.
To break something made of ice.
To start a physical fight.

usage_options.text: At the start of the workshop, the facilitator told a joke to break the ice.
During the winter, he often breaks the ice on the walkway.
The comedian used his best jokes to break the ice with the audience.
She broke the ice of the frozen lake to rescue the trapped fish.

meaning_options.text: To stay up very late at night working or studying.
To waste energy in an unproductive way.
To participate in night time leisure activities.
To light a lamp using oil.

usage_options.text: She burned the midnight oil to finish her thesis on time.
The team burned the midnight oil to meet the project deadline.
He often burns the midnight oil playing video games, not studying.
To prepare for the finals, students are burning the midnight oil at the library.

meaning_options.text: Cooking a large fish for dinner.
Having more important matters to attend to.
Looking for bigger opportunities in life.
Trying to solve big problems.

usage_options.text: He didnâ€™t attend the meeting, as he had bigger fish to fry.
She always dreams about bigger fish to fry instead of focusing on her current tasks.
During the fishing trip, they literally had bigger fish to fry.
Managing the new project is like having bigger fish to fry compared to his previous tasks.
